name: Plants and people
description: Plants can be characters in stories, and we often project human qualities onto them, but how do they see the world?

key_work.title: Epiphytes
key_work.credit_line:
2022

Tully Arnot, b. 1984, Gadigal land

Lives and works, Hong Kong

Free-roam virtual reality environment, spatial sound, scent, carpet, reading room

Created in collaboration with Dr Josh Harle of Tactical Space Lab
key_work.material_description: Oculus Quest 2 virtual reality headset, APK files, reading material, furniture and mixed media
key_work.brief_description: Epiphytes is a VR work by Australian artist Tully Arnot promoting a plant-based perspective. Reflecting Arnot’s interest in how emergent technologies help form human understanding of the world, the visually diffuse nature of the work is deliberate. In Epiphytes, the primacy of sight is de-escalated, and sound and scent become key - used by Arnot to manipulate our bodily responses within the virtual space. “Epiphytes” encourages audiences to adjust the way we understand our own senses of perception by drawing our attention to alternative forms of plant communication and consciousness.

constellations_primary.name: Plants and people
constellations_primary.description: Plants can be characters in stories, and we often project human qualities onto them, but how do they see the world?

start.title: Adventures of Batman & Robin: Poison Ivy/The Penguin
start.brief_description: Adventures of Batman & Robin Poison Ivy: A grade school teacher takes a night job working for a rough nightclub owner. Beneath his tough exterior, though, her new boss is kind and very protective of her. Adventures of Batman & Robin: The Penguin: Penguin, ever crafty, takes on Batman in a battle for control of the free world!

constellations_other.name: Plants and people
constellations_other.description: Plants can be characters in stories, and we often project human qualities onto them, but how do they see the world?

end.title: WALL·E
end.brief_description: WALL·E is the last robot left on an Earth that has been overrun with garbage and all humans have fled to outer space. For 700 years he has continued to try and clean up the mess, but has developed some rather interesting human-like qualities.

constellations_other.name: Distributed Consciousness
constellations_other.description: Distributed Consciousness mixes NFT technology and custom AI software created by the artist to question artificial intelligence, ecology, sustainability, consciousness and free will - just like the works in this Constellation.

constellations_other.name: Plants and people
constellations_other.description: Plants can be characters in stories, and we often project human qualities onto them, but how do they see the world?

constellations_other.name: Silent adventures (Hollow Knight - Education)
constellations_other.description: Videogames, film and TV usually rely on the spoken word to communicate character and story. It wasn’t always this way. Although we may think of ‘silent films’ as in the past, there are contemporary videogames and films that shy away from using the spoken word.

links.description: Poison Ivy has plant and human DNA mixed, a futurist fantasy of inter-species existence. In the scorched earth future of Wall-E, one lone seedling survives, carrying the hope of all humanity in its green shoots.

start.title: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
start.creator_credit: David Hand, Virginia Lockwood, Walt Disney, Walt Disney Productions, Dick Rickard, Dorothy Ann Blank, Earl Hurd, Merrill De Maris, Otto Englander, Richard Creedon, Ted Sears, Webb Smith and Bob Broughton
start.brief_description: Snow White, takes refuge in the forest in the house of seven dwarfs to hide from her stepmother, the wicked Queen. The Queen is jealous because she wants to be “the fairest in the land,” and Snow White’s beauty surpasses her own.

constellations_other.name: Cautionary tales and magic lantern projectors
constellations_other.description: Early magic lantern projections depicted cautionary religious scenes and fairytales, just like cinema did in its infancy.

constellations_other.name: Plants and people
constellations_other.description: Plants can be characters in stories, and we often project human qualities onto them, but how do they see the world?

end.title: Adventures of Batman & Robin: Poison Ivy/The Penguin
end.brief_description: Adventures of Batman & Robin Poison Ivy: A grade school teacher takes a night job working for a rough nightclub owner. Beneath his tough exterior, though, her new boss is kind and very protective of her. Adventures of Batman & Robin: The Penguin: Penguin, ever crafty, takes on Batman in a battle for control of the free world!

constellations_other.name: Plants and people
constellations_other.description: Plants can be characters in stories, and we often project human qualities onto them, but how do they see the world?

links.description: The trees in Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs are drawn with human qualities to make them appear more scary. In the Batman Universe, Poison Ivy is part human and part plant, and can kill with her poisonous kiss!

start.title: Epiphytes
start.credit_line:
2022

Tully Arnot, b. 1984, Gadigal land

Lives and works, Hong Kong

Free-roam virtual reality environment, spatial sound, scent, carpet, reading room

Created in collaboration with Dr Josh Harle of Tactical Space Lab
start.material_description: Oculus Quest 2 virtual reality headset, APK files, reading material, furniture and mixed media
start.brief_description: Epiphytes is a VR work by Australian artist Tully Arnot promoting a plant-based perspective. Reflecting Arnot’s interest in how emergent technologies help form human understanding of the world, the visually diffuse nature of the work is deliberate. In Epiphytes, the primacy of sight is de-escalated, and sound and scent become key - used by Arnot to manipulate our bodily responses within the virtual space. “Epiphytes” encourages audiences to adjust the way we understand our own senses of perception by drawing our attention to alternative forms of plant communication and consciousness.

constellations_primary.name: Plants and people
constellations_primary.description: Plants can be characters in stories, and we often project human qualities onto them, but how do they see the world?

end.title: Flower
end.brief_description: When Jenova Chen and Nicholas Clark designed Flower, they approached it as more of an interactive artwork than a traditional videogame.

constellations_other.name: Flower on the wind
constellations_other.description: Explore the use of flowers in the moving image as an aesthetic and metaphor.

constellations_other.name: Plants and people
constellations_other.description: Plants can be characters in stories, and we often project human qualities onto them, but how do they see the world?

links.description: Epiphytes invites you to imagine how a plant experiences the world, while Flower lets you play as a breeze, floating through the landscape.

end.title: The Secret Garden
end.creator_credit: Agnieszka Holland, Marit Allen, Isabelle Lorente, Fred Fuchs, Fred Roos, Tom Luddy, American Zoetrope, Warner Bros. Pictures, Stuart Craig and Caroline Thompson
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1993

video_links.name: The Secret Garden (1993) - Original Theatrical Trailer

end.brief_description: A young British girl born and reared in India loses her neglectful parents in an earthquake. She is returned to England to live at her uncle’s castle. Her uncle is very distant due to the loss of his wife ten years before. Neglected once again, she begins exploring the estate and discovers a garden that has been locked and neglected. Aided by one of the servants’ boys, she begins restoring the garden, and eventually discovers some other secrets of the manor.

constellations_other.name: Plants and people
constellations_other.description: Plants can be characters in stories, and we often project human qualities onto them, but how do they see the world?

links.description: Flying though grasslands in the game Flower is a meditative experience; tending to a derelict garden in The Secret Garden brings healing and happiness to three lonely children.

start.title: The Secret Garden

video_links.name: The Secret Garden (1993) - Original Theatrical Trailer

start.brief_description: A young British girl born and reared in India loses her neglectful parents in an earthquake. She is returned to England to live at her uncle’s castle. Her uncle is very distant due to the loss of his wife ten years before. Neglected once again, she begins exploring the estate and discovers a garden that has been locked and neglected. Aided by one of the servants’ boys, she begins restoring the garden, and eventually discovers some other secrets of the manor.

end.brief_description: Snow White, takes refuge in the forest in the house of seven dwarfs to hide from her stepmother, the wicked Queen. The Queen is jealous because she wants to be “the fairest in the land,” and Snow White’s beauty surpasses her own.

constellations_other.description: Early magic lantern projections depicted cautionary religious scenes and fairytales, just like cinema did in its infancy.

constellations_other.name: Plants and people
constellations_other.description: Plants can be characters in stories, and we often project human qualities onto them, but how do they see the world?

links.description: In The Secret Garden, tending a garden is a metaphor for looking after one’s spirit. In Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, trees are given human form, with scary faces and grasping branch-hands as Snow White runs terrified through the forest.
